item.title: Cho19 - On the Measure of Intelligence
item.description:
Overview #

The main goal of the AI field since inception has been to create systems with human-like intelligence. However, Chollet argues that this goal is unachievable given bd there hasn’t been a clear definition of intelligence, nor a standard way to measure it.

In this paper, he proposes a formal definition of intelligence, and a set of guidelines for how a general AI benchmark should look.

He introduces the Abstraction and Reasoning Corpus (ARC), as a tool for evaluating artificial fluid intelligence.
